intro: Canthium neilgherrense var. chartacea, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge. It is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its latex-like sap, which is toxic to humans and animals. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
